com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset

Class Bluetooth

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Bluetooth

  • public final class Bluetooth
extends Object
    The Bluetooth class facilitates communication between an Android device and a Bluetooth accessory.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Bluetooth.Delegate
      The Bluetooth.Delegate interface defines methods that will be called from a Bluetooth instance to inform an interested object (typically the entity that creates the Bluetooth class) of changes to the Bluetooth instance's state.

    • Field Detail

      • kBluetoothServiceSPP

        public static final UUID kBluetoothServiceSPP
        The Bluetooth Serial Port Profile (SPP) UUID

      • REQUEST_ENABLE_BT

        public static final int REQUEST_ENABLE_BT
        The integer value passed to startActivityForResult() when enableBluetoothAdapter() is called. You listen for this value in your onActivityResult() method (see Android documentation for startActivityForResult( Intent, int ) and Avnera's sample code in MainActivity.java.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bluetooth

        public Bluetooth(Bluetooth.Delegate delegate,
                 Activity activity,
                 boolean secureRfcomm)
          throws IOException
        Instantiate a Bluetooth object for communication between an Android device and a Bluetooth accessory. After instantiation, call start() to begin searching for devices.
        Parameters:
        delegate - The receiver of Bluetooth.delegate messages. This parameter cannot be null.
        activity - The Android Activity to use for event registration. This parameter cannot be null.
        secureRfcomm - true if the device supports an encrypted link key (Bluetooth 2.1+ devices), false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if BluetoothAdapter.getDefaultAdapter() fails (in which case the device does not support Bluetooth).

    • Method Detail

      • bondStateDescription

        public static String bondStateDescription(int bondState)
        Returns a string describing the passed bondState. This method is primarily useful for debugging/logging.
        Parameters:
        bondState - one of the BluetoothDevice.BOND_* constants (e.g. BOND_BONDED)
        Returns:
        A string describing the bond state

      • cancelDiscovery

        public void cancelDiscovery()
        Cancels Bluetooth discovery mode. Automatically called when you call connect().

      • close

        public void close()
        Call close() to disconnect all connected devices and shutdown this instance.

      • connect

        public void connect(BluetoothDevice device)
             throws IOException
        Connect to a Bluetooth device. Only devices reported via the delegate's bluetoothDeviceDiscovered() callback are valid. Once connect() is called for a device, the Bluetooth class will attempt to auto-reconnect to any disconnected devices until either disconnect() is explicitly called or an error occurs (such as closing the socket). Calling connect will cancel any in-progress Bluetooth device discovery.
        Parameters:
        device - The Bluetooth device to connect to
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the device does not support SPP or if createRfcommSocketToServiceRecord() fails

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(BluetoothDevice device)
        Disconnect the connected Bluetooth device
        Parameters:
        device - The Bluetooth device to disconnect

      • deviceName

        public String deviceName(BluetoothDevice device)
        Get the Bluetooth device's name
        Parameters:
        device - The Bluetooth device
        Returns:
        The name of the Bluetooth device

      • deviceSupportsProfile

        public boolean deviceSupportsProfile(BluetoothDevice device,
                                     UUID bluetoothProfileUUID)
        Check to see if the specified device supports a particular Bluetooth profile.
        Parameters:
        device - The Bluetooth device to query for profile support
        bluetoothProfileUUID - A Bluetooth profile UUID
        Returns:
        true if the device supports the Bluetooth profile, false otherwise.

      • discoverBluetoothDevices

        public void discoverBluetoothDevices()
        Puts the Android device's BluetoothAdapter in discovery mode. This is a high energy-consumption mode and requires the Bluetooth peripheral device to be discoverable.

      • isDiscovering

        public boolean isDiscovering()
        Returns true if the BluetoothAdapter is in discovery mode.
        Returns:
        true if the BluetoothAdapter is in discovery mode, false otherwise

      • start

        public void start()
        start() performs the following actions: 1. The system BluetoothAdapter is queried to see if it is enabled. If it is not, a request to enable the BluetoothAdapter is initiated (see notes below) and start() exits. 2. If the Bluetooth adapter is enabled, the list of paired devices is scanned. If any paired devices exist start() exits and the delegate will be notified via the bluetoothDeviceBonded() callback of the paired devices. 3. If no paired devices are found, Bluetooth discovery() is initiated. Only Bluetooth devices that are set to be discoverable (usually via user action) can be discovered. Discovery is a high-power mode and will drain the user's battery so be sure to let the user know they should make sure their headset is discoverable. Note: In the event a request to enable the Bluetooth adapter is initiated, the user will be prompted. Upon success or failure the Activity registered with the Bluetooth instance via its constructor will have its onActivityResult() method called. The requestCode value will be REQUEST_ENABLE_BT or RESULT_CANCELED if the enable request succeeded or failed respectively. If the Bluetooth adapter was enabled, the process described in steps 2 and 3 above will begin automatically.

      • pair

        public boolean pair(BluetoothDevice device)
        Initiate pairing (bonding) with a bluetooth device.
        Parameters:
        device - the Bluetooth device to pair to
        Returns:
        true if the pairing process was successfully started, false otherwise
